sentences.content: Marine mammal by-catch is a significant pressure affecting populations in the North-East Atlantic.
Waters (Region I), a Pilot Assessment was possible for two species (harbour porpoise and grey seal) ...
Iceland Assessment Unit (AU) based on the US conservation objective (PBR), resulting in grey seal
Harbour porpoise and grey seal are among the most commonly by-caught marine mammal species in the
OSPAR Maritime Area according to records from observer monitoring.
In Region I, only the Iceland AU could
be assessed from within this large Region.
In 2020, it was estimated that some 1 700 harbour porpoises died as a result of by-catch in the Icel...

of PBR to set the threshold and using outputs from a model for the abundance estimate.
